title: Turquoise Sea No. 1, 1920, Tangier
credit_line: Gift of Miss Alice B. Robinson in memory of Mr. and Mrs. George B. Gordon
provenance_text:
Sir John Lavery [1856-1941], London, England, until 1925 [1]; Mrs. George B. Gordon, Pittsburgh, PA [2]. Alice B. Robinson; gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1973.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was exhibited in the "Twenty-fourth Annual International Exhibition of Paintings" at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1925 (no. 147, see photo in Carnegie International photo archive.)
[2]. Mrs. Gordon purchased the painting from the 1925 International for $750 (see copy of relevant document from Archives of American Art in curatorial file.)

creator.death_place: Kilkenny (County Kilkenny, Leinster, Republic of Ireland)
